Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel apartments”
Reviews.Author: victoriatze
Reviews.Content: We have spent a month in the apartments of the hotel with two children, 6 and 9 yeas old. The kitchen was fully equipped (it even had a dishwasher !!) and you could find everything in a walking distance, supermarkets (2), restaurants, pizzerias and a wonderful park with a small shopping center and the best playground i have ever seen, parco leonardo. It is a little difficult to reach the center if you don't have a car, i mean that it takes long, otherwise the bus stop is right outside the hotel. An excellent place to be with small children if you have to stay in Rome for some time, as i did, in the summer there is also a swimming pool nearby. Very clean , and the staff extremely friendly...

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel Layout”
Reviews.Author: manjujitendra
Reviews.Content: During our Europe Trip organised through Star Tours we spent night of October 4' 11 at this nicely designed hotel. Hotel is neat and clean and good for one night stay. It located on outskirts of the town good to accommodate the large bus and caravan

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: StarrOxford
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Though if I hadn't had work in the area and a collegue to pick me up I wouldn't have actually chosen it. I think a lot of business people choose it because they don't have to navigate the horrors of getting into Rome. It is clean and modern and the rooms are pleasant and up to date. Nice balconies with views. The reception isn't very friendly - more interested in its own conversations than dealing with clients, but the barman is a delight and makes wonderful drinks with lots of biscuits with hot drinks and nibbles with cocktails. In a nice modern residential area with a good fish restaurant across the square.

Reviews.Title: “Poor in most ways”
Reviews.Author: zumzum101
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Sunday evening and I was really hungry, the hotel would't serve food because it was sunday. The reception refused to charge my phone (all I had with me was a USB charger and no laptop) At the conference the food was all fish with no choice, starting with raw fish, followed by clam pasta (both I couldn't eat as I am pregnant!) Staff were rude, so much so that myself any many of my colleagues checked out 2 days early.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT 4 STAR! WE STAYED AT THIS HOTEL FOR A TOTAL OF 30 DAYS”
Reviews.Author: globetraveler50
Reviews.Content: this hotel was our home-base,during a 2 months vacation in Italy.We stayed in a junior suite,a lovely little apartment very functional and very modern and clean! And best of all the price was most reasonable. The staff was great and took care of all of our needs and English is a second language at this hotel! We had weekly maid service, the building and the grounds are very well taken care of and spotless!The complex is gated with private garden area, our apartment had a balcony facing the garden,very nice and quiet. The location is good,by car not far to access major highways not far from Rome or the airport,also just few miles from the beach. Just next door to the complex there is a very good "Tavola calda" you can even order your food and it will be ready for lunch time, your morning cappuccino there is a very nice bar just around the corner! There are also many restaurants in the area called Casal Palocco,just near the hotel,few miles away there is even a Mcdonald in a nice shopping area. The street in front of the hotel is a busy one...but it is Italy after all!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, lots of traffic”
Reviews.Author: CNJABQ
Reviews.Content: While we thought this would be relatively close to Fiumicino airport for one overnight before flying on to Palermo, it turned into a long, 40Euro taxi ride. Very much a modern neighborhood location, with the convenience of small restaurants, macellaria (with great take away) pizzaria, pasticceria and a bank with an ATM machine all close by. Room was very clean and modern. Ombretta and Annamaria at the front desk were extremely helpful (and pretty). Annamaria makes a mean cafe w. grappa at the friendly little bar right inside the lobby. The street in front of the hotel had traffic continuously until 1:00 a.m Monday night. Apple could use the amplification technology provided by the windows in its next iphone, as our beds might as well have been on the sidewalk. Maybe a room on the back would have been quieter, but there is a street there to (ergo, Triangoli?) Breakfast was standard. Decent place but would not return due to noise and a little out of the way from what we expected.

Reviews.Title: ““…hotel with the worse service ever….””
Reviews.Author: debef
Reviews.Content: I stay there for a few weeks but to be frank this hotel have the worse service ever...and I travel a lot, in all sort of places from B&B to a 5 stars hotel, for me this is the hotel with the worse service ever, I even wonder if this belong to Best Western. When talking the reception doesn’t even try to look at me, she talked arrogantly while doing her work, for me, it is so rude, especially when you are in the hotel business. My personal opinion, there’s no family spirit in the hotel. They refuse to answer the call (I made more than 5 calls), I’m so angry and I went to the desk to check, there they were there with no customer, I’m still wondering why they didn’t answer. The internet is so slow, I made so many complaint but still nothing was done. Location wise, its near to the airport, took about 30minues to the airport and they provide shuttle service (in advance). Going to Rome is quite a challenge here, you can took the bus (only running from 6.30am to 8pm) to the nearest metro station, and the bus journey took you about 45 minutes. Coming back to the hotel, you to be at the station by 7.30pm so that you wouldn’t miss the last bus. The room is clean and tidy with new furniture and stuff and the garden is beautiful and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible directions from airport to a...”
Reviews.Author: CaPalm
Reviews.Content: Horrible directions from airport to a fine hotel

Reviews.Title: “this is not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: wouter-27
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely not a four star hotel, it could pass for three stars. The breakfast is poor, the badroom worked only partly, the showercurtain had fungus and so did the silicone seem around the bad. Room and the whole hotel are constructed with cheap materials and service is poor. Beside this the locatation of the hotel is in one of this hyperclean finex nabourhoods very far out of Rome centre. We paid 107 euro for one night which is a ripoff. the hotel is not near the airport so you should ad 40 euros for the taxi because public transport is very difficult from this area. The website is mentioning a future gym and swimmingpool which are both not available and not in the planning soon.

Reviews.Title: “30th Wedding Anniversary Suprise”
Reviews.Author: susi080
Reviews.Content: Didnt know how far out of Rome the hotel was used a taxi from Ciampino Airport and was charged Euro 90 even though it was an official white taxi. Reception staff very helpful day & night. Rooms clean & comfortable. Took the bus and Metro daily to get to & around Rome only problem the bus that stops outside hotels finishes at 8:30pm and the Resturant in the hotel has only one menu that doesnt change and is expensive for what you get, we had no car so looking for somewhere to eat within walking distance was non existant. Breakfast was good and again service good. The bar of a night was hit & miss no one serving. I wouldnt recommend unless you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service”
Reviews.Author: patrickoo
Reviews.Content: We chose a hotel outside Rome as we were by car. This hotel is brand new. The rooms are clean and well equipped. The staff is friendly and helpful. Good bus/metro connection to Rome. Lido di Ostia Antica is nearby. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for your final night in Rome before returning rental car and flying out”
Reviews.Author: waltbru
Reviews.Content: Some say that there are no quality, affordable hotels near Rome's Fiumicino airport. I must respectfully disagree. First, with the idea of staying the last night in Rome prior to an early departure, since the uncertainty of a $50 taxi ride in traffic adds an unecessary knot to your stomach. Second, with the idea that there are no good hotels near the airport. We just got back from a trip to Italy and had rental cars with us. We stayed at the Best Western I Triangoli (http://www.romehotel-itriangoli.it/) for 100 Euros per night. The hotel was newly-built, had enclosed, locked, free parking, had free wifi, free breakfast buffet, and was a 15 minute drive to the airport, where we dropped off our cars. There is a gas station 100 yards from the hotel where we filled up prior to returning our cars. This place is highly recommended for those driving cars and/or having early morning departures where minimal variables are desired. My only caveat is that the airport has non-existent signs directing you to the rental car return. You have to loop inside the airport in a tightening spiral, into the "Arrival" area, with no signage until the end. But if you're returning a rental car and flying out in the morning from Rome, this hotel is the one. Look no further.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: AngusMcDonald
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time we stayed near Rome and this was the best value. It was out in the suburbs, but not with high rise apartments. A 4star hotel for 68 euros which included a magnificient breakfast. There are plenty of eating places within walking distance as well as shops and a supermarket. I chose this hotel as it was close to the drop off point for our car before flying out of italy. i would use it again. secure Parking underneath the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Krakus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It is modern and business-like, and the rooms are quite small. However, our room was nicely furnished with wood paneling, and the bathroom was modern and functional. In fact, this was the first hotel we found where all the appliances worked. Parking is free and so is the in-room Internet access which is supplied via an Ethernet cable. The beds were fairly comfortable. It was very bright in the room and the air conditioning was very effective, in fact, probably too much so. The breakfast selection was among the best we had seen on our trip. The hotel is perfectly situated within a 20 min drive of the airport, although be warned that if you are heading out on a weekday morning, the rush hour traffic makes it closer to a 1.5 hour drive. It is still much better than trying to get back directly from Rome. So overall this hotel is a wise choice for a last night when flying back from the Rome airport. We just wish the rooms were larger.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but it needs a restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Oskathedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Triangoli recently on a quick visit to Rome. We picked it because of it's location and proximity to Fiumicino Airport, which is about 40 minutes away if the traffic is not too heavy. The hotel is quite new, a bit like an upmarket Premier Travel Inn , the rooms are compact but nicely done, clean, decent bathroom, TV(confusing), balcony, air con, mini bar(expensive) but no kettle. The breakfast is excellent, catering for the mainly American guests, with a varied selection of scrambled and fried eggs, cold meats, rolls and croissants, juices, fruit, cereals and of course good coffee. The staff are friendly and efficient, but their travel directions are a bit confusing because of the way the roads are actually laid out! We were given directions to the EUR metro about 15 minutes away, missed it completely and found ourselves still looking for it an hour later when we got to the city walls! The only downside to this hotel, apart from it being so far from a metro station for access to the center of Rome, is the fact that it has no restaurant to cater for guests in the evening, so the reception staff have to point you to a local restaurant. The first one they sent us to was really expensive, the second night we went to Il Cuoco Pazzo (crazy chef) which was a bit better value. If you go, look out for Kamal, the pizza chef from Egypt who speaks excellent English and is actually a qualified vet! He asked us to translate the specials menu into English, which, when printed, might help non Italian speakers a little!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, one bad woman at reception”
Reviews.Author: AmericanItalian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, the rooms are well furnished, the parking in the garage is free...but...the woman at the reception was completely unhelpful and very rude. I'd go back except for the fact that I might have to deal with her again. I've actually cancelled my reservation for next week because of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but it needs a restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Oskathedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Triangoli recently on a quick visit to Rome. We picked it because of it's location and proximity to Fiumicino Airport, which is about 40 minutes away if the traffic is not too heavy. The hotel is quite new, a bit like an upmarket Premier Travel Inn , the rooms are compact but nicely done, clean, decent bathroom, TV(confusing), balcony, air con, mini bar(expensive) but no kettle. The breakfast is excellent, catering for the mainly American guests, with a varied selection of scrambled and fried eggs, cold meats, rolls and croissants, juices, fruit, cereals and of course good coffee. The staff are friendly and efficient, but their travel directions are a bit confusing because of the way the roads are actually laid out! We were given directions to the EUR metro about 15 minutes away, missed it completely and found ourselves still looking for it an hour later when we got to the city walls! The only downside to this hotel, apart from it being so far from a metro station for access to the center of Rome, is the fact that it has no restaurant to cater for guests in the evening, so the reception staff have to point you to a local restaurant. The first one they sent us to was really expensive, the second night we went to Il Cuoco Pazzo (crazy chef) which was a bit better value. If you go, look out for Kamal, the pizza chef from Egypt who speaks excellent English and is actually a qualified vet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SusanBakersfield_CA
Reviews.Content: We had a very early flight from Fiuminico. The hotel was very clean with spacious rooms. They arranged for our transportation to the airport which arrived at the exact time. It was 42 euros for four of us with 7 bags. The hotel is situated in a quiet area about 20 minutes to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: MarkMaz
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for our last night in Rome because we thought it was close to the airport. Well, it sort of is and sort of isn't, and since our International flight left before their "free" shuttle started, we had to take a taxi at a whopping cost of $50 euros. Still, the hotel itself was great, the room top notch, the bar and restaurant great, and a nearby restaurant just down the street was also super. There maybe a hotel closer to the airport than this one for an early start to fly home but I doubt that you will find a nice hotel at around $100-$130 euros depending on the season. The staff was also extremely friendly. Would definitely choose again if needed.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN I Triangoli
HotelInfo.Address: Via Ermanno Wolf ferrari 285, 00124 Rome, Italy
